variants.title: A small valuable (gem, art), worth 2d10x10 coins
Some minor magical trinket, choose appropriate
A small item (gem, art) of great value (2d6x100 coins)
A chest of coins and other small valuables, worth 3d6x100
A magical item or magical effect, choose appropriate
Many bags of coins, 2d4x100 or so
A sign of the office (crown, banner), worth 3d4x100 coins
Unique item worth at least 5d4x100 coins
Everything needed to learn a new spell, and roll again
A portal or secret path (or direction to one), and roll again
Something relating to one of the characters, and roll again
A hoard: 1d10x1000 coins and 1d10x10 gems worth 2d6x100 each
Unnatural Feature. How does it affect its surroundings?
Natural Feature. Describe how they notice it and what sets it apart.
Limited area of an another TERRAIN type
Evidence. Consider the implications and be ready for them to take the bait.
Creature. Not an immediate threat, but might become one.
Structure. Who built it? Is it connected to anything else they made nearby?
Unnatural Entity. Describe it—creepy, twisted, awe-inspiring.
Beast . Start with a real-world creature, then put a spin in it.
Humanoid. If you roll a classic fantasy species, adapt it to your setting.

variants.static: Poor, Steady, Militia, Resource (GM choice) and has an Oath (steading of GM's choice).

additional.title: If the village is part of a kingdom or empire

variants.title: Built around a wizard's tower: Personage (that wizard), Blight (arcane creatures)
Built on a site of religious significance: Divine, History (GM choice)
Surrounded by arid or uncultivated land: Need (food)
Dedicated to a deity:Religious (that deity), Enmity (steading of opposing deity)
Recently at war: -Population, -Prosperity if they fought to the end, -Defences if they lost
Remote or unwelcoming: -Prosperity, Dwarven or Elvenor other non-human

additional.title: If the town is listed as Trade by another steading

variants.title: Built around a craft: Craft (your choice), Resource (something required for that craft)
Outgrowing a vital resource: Need (that resource), Trade (a steading with that resource)
Outlaw rumoured to live there: Personage (the outlaw), Enmity (steading preyed upon)
Controls a good/service: Exotic (that good/service), Enmity (steading with ambition)

additional.title: If the keepis owed fealty by at least one ther steading

variants.title: Run by a skilled commander: Personage (the commander), +Defenses
Stands watch over a trade road: +Prosperity, Guild (trade)
Stands on a border: +Defences, Enmity (steading on the other side of the border
Built on a naturally defensible position: Safe, -Population
Formerly occupied by another power: Enmity (steaing of thet power)
Built to defend from specific threat: Blight (that threat)
Has seen horrible bloody war: History (battle), Blight (restless spirits)
Is given the worst of the worst: Need (skilled recruits)

additional.title: If the city has trade with and fealty from at least 1 steading

variants.title: Permanent defenses, such as walls: +Defenses, Oath (GM's choice)
Ruled by a single individual: Personage (the ruler), Power (political)
Ancient, built on top of its own ruins: History (your choice), Divine
Occupies place of power: Arcane, Personage (whoever watches the place of power), Blight (arcane creatures)

dictionaries.title: Dungeon Discovery. A starting point: extrapolate, embellish, integrate.
Dungeon Danger. If they would notice, show signs of an approaching threat.
Context and occupation: Who are they and where they come from
Trait: If you want someone memorable, roll for other categories additionally

variants.title: Roll again, but add contradictory detail of your choice
Roll again, but add contradictory detail of your choice
Roll again, but add contradictory detail of your choice

title: NPC follower: reconcile to the fiction, tag, and equip as you see fit

variants.title: Past their prime: -1 to Quality, +1 Wise
Has lived a life of danger: +2 tags
Has lived a life of privilege: +1 tag
Solitary: It lives and fights alone.
Group: Usually seen in small numbers, 3–6 or so.
Horde: Where there’s one, there’s more. A lot more.
Tiny: It’s much smaller than a halfling.
Large: It’s much bigger than a human, about as big as a cart.
Huge: It’s as big as a small house or larger.
Amorphous: Its anatomy and organs are bizarre and unnatural.
Cautious: It prizes survival over aggression.
Construct: It was made, not born.
Devious: Its main danger lies beyond the simple clash of battle.
Intelligent: It’s smart enough that some individuals pick up other skills. The GM can adapt the monster by adding tags to reflect specific training, like a mage or warrior.
Magical: It is by nature magical through and through.
Organized: It has a group structure that aids it in survival. Defeating one may cause the wrath of others. One may sound an alarm.
Planar: It’s from beyond this world.
Stealthy: It can avoid detection and prefers to attack with the element of surprise.
Terrifying: Its presence and appearance evoke fear.
